meanings.definition: Opposed to revolution or revolutionary movements.
meanings.sent1: Her father held antirevolutionary beliefs and always spoke out against any form of rebellion.
meanings.sent2: The antirevolutionary group protested peacefully against the proposed changes.
meanings.sent3: The antirevolutionary cat refused to play with the new toy mouse, sticking to its old favorite instead.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood tall and antirevolutionary, resisting the winds of change.
meanings.sent5: The antirevolutionary stance of the town council was evident in their refusal to modernize the infrastructure.

meanings.definition: A person who is against revolution or revolutionary ideas.
meanings.sent1: As an antirevolutionary, he believed in maintaining the status quo and avoiding any drastic changes.
meanings.sent2: The antirevolutionary was known for his conservative views and opposition to radical reforms.
meanings.sent3: The antirevolutionary at the party joked that he preferred evolution over revolution when it came to dance moves.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a lone antirevolutionary in a sea of passionate activists, standing firm in her beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The history book portrayed the antirevolutionary as a figure who valued tradition and stability above all else.
